sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: This manual provides a detailed guide for processing invoices at FAST Logistics. It outlines the step-by-step workflow, validations, and attributes required to ensure efficient and accurate invoice processing. Additionally, it covers how to handle exceptions and raise tickets for issues encountered during the process.

subsections.title: Step 1: Receive the Invoice
subsections.description: The first step in the invoice processing workflow is to receive the invoice from the vendor.
process: Collect invoices from various channels (email, mail, electronic systems).
Log the receipt of the invoice in the system.
validations: Ensure the invoice is from an approved vendor.
Verify the invoice date is within the acceptable range.

subsections.title: Step 2: Validate the Invoice Details
subsections.description: The second step involves validating the details provided in the invoice.
process: Check that all mandatory fields are completed.
Verify the accuracy of the invoice details against purchase orders and contracts.
validations: Ensure all mandatory fields are completed.

subsections.title: Step 3: Approve the Invoice
subsections.description: The third step is to approve the invoice for payment.
process: Review the invoice details and ensure they match the purchase order.
Obtain necessary approvals from authorized personnel.
validations: Verify the invoice amount matches the purchase order.

subsections.title: Step 4: Process the Payment
subsections.description: The fourth step is to process the payment for the approved invoice.
process: Prepare the payment details and schedule the payment.
Execute the payment through the appropriate payment method.

subsections.title: Step 5: Archive the Invoice
subsections.description: The final step is to archive the processed invoice for record-keeping.
process: Ensure the invoice is fully processed and all steps are completed.
Store the invoice in the designated repository.
validations: Check if the invoice is fully processed.
Ensure the invoice is stored in the correct repository.

sections.title: Exceptions and Handling
sections.content: This section outlines the common exceptions that may occur during the invoice processing workflow and how to handle them.

subsections.title: Common Exceptions
content: Missing Information: If mandatory fields are missing, contact the vendor to provide the necessary information.
Discrepancies: If there are discrepancies between the invoice and the purchase order, investigate and resolve the issue before proceeding.
Duplicate Invoices: If a duplicate invoice is detected, verify with the vendor and ensure only one invoice is processed.

subsections.title: Handling Process
content: Identify the exception and log it in the system.
Take appropriate action to resolve the issue.
Document the resolution and update the invoice status.

sections.title: Raising Tickets
sections.content: This section explains how to raise tickets for issues encountered during the invoice processing workflow.
process: Identify the issue and gather relevant details.
Log the issue in the ticketing system with a detailed description.
Assign the ticket to the appropriate team or personnel for resolution.
Track the progress of the ticket and ensure timely resolution.
Update the ticket status and close it once the issue is resolved.

sections.title: Validations and Checks
sections.content: This section provides a comprehensive list of validations and checks to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the invoice processing workflow.
validations: Vendor Validation: Ensure the invoice is from an approved vendor.
Date Validation: Verify the invoice date is within the acceptable range.
Field Validation: Ensure all mandatory fields are completed.
Duplicate Check: Check for duplicate invoices.
Amount Validation: Verify the invoice amount matches the purchase order.
Authorization Check: Ensure proper authorization is obtained for invoice approval.
Payment Validation: Ensure payment details are correct and the payment method is verified.
Archival Check: Ensure the invoice is fully processed and stored in the correct repository.
checks: Consistency Check: Ensure consistency between the invoice, purchase order, and contract details.
Accuracy Check: Verify the accuracy of the invoice details.
Completeness Check: Ensure all steps in the workflow are completed.
